cities.name: Bologna

Art & Culture.name: Piazza Maggiore & Basilica di San Petronio
Art & Culture.description: The heart of Bologna with the massive brick Basilica di San Petronio, historic palazzi, and chill street vibes perfect for people-watching between sights.

Art & Culture.name: Archiginnasio & Anatomical Theatre
Art & Culture.description: Former seat of Europe‚Äôs oldest university. The wooden Anatomical Theatre (built 1637) looks like a real-life Hogwarts lecture hall.

Art & Culture.name: The Two Towers (Le Due Torri)
Art & Culture.description: Iconic medieval towers that lean at dramatic angles. Climb Torre Asinelli for wow-level city views (check access on site).

Art & Culture.name: Pinacoteca Nazionale di Bologna
Art & Culture.description: Masterpieces by Giotto, Raffaello, and the Bolognese school. A compact, calm museum that‚Äôs easy to enjoy in under two hours.

Art & Culture.name: MAMbo ‚Äì Museum of Modern Art
Art & Culture.description: Contemporary art, installations, and rotating exhibits in a bright industrial space; great for creative inspiration.

Photo Spots.name: Finestrella di Via Piella
Photo Spots.description: Open the little window to reveal Bologna‚Äôs hidden canal‚Äîlike a mini Venice moment tucked between buildings.

Photo Spots.name: Porticoes of Bologna
Photo Spots.description: Kilometers of UNESCO-listed arcades. Soft light, repeating arches, and terracotta tones = dreamy camera roll.

Photo Spots.name: Santo Stefano Complex (Seven Churches)
Photo Spots.description: Atmospheric courtyards and brickwork; medieval textures everywhere. Perfect for moody shots.

Photo Spots.name: Portico di San Luca & Sanctuary
Photo Spots.description: A 3.8 km arcade leading uphill to a hilltop sanctuary. Sunset views over red roofs are next-level.

Food & Nightlife.name: Quadrilatero Market
Food & Nightlife.description: Bustling historic food lanes by Piazza Maggiore. Sample mortadella, parmigiano, tortellini, and balsamic tastings.

Food & Nightlife.name: Mercato di Mezzo
Food & Nightlife.description: Indoor food court with everything from fresh pasta to desserts. Great for groups with different tastes.

Food & Nightlife.name: Osteria del Sole
Food & Nightlife.description: Legendary no-frills wine bar (since 1465!). Bring your own snacks from nearby delis; enjoy authentic local energy.

Food & Nightlife.name: Via del Pratello
Food & Nightlife.description: Studenty street with casual bars and aperitivo spots‚Äîgood vibes, street art, and late-night chatter.

Food & Nightlife.name: Carpigiani Gelato Museum (nearby)
Food & Nightlife.description: A quick trip out of town for the story of gelato + tastings. Nerdy and delicious.

Nature & Relaxation.name: Giardini Margherita
Nature & Relaxation.description: Bologna‚Äôs biggest park: lakeside paths, skate spots, and picnic lawns‚Äîperfect between museum stops.

Nature & Relaxation.name: Orto Botanico di Bologna
Nature & Relaxation.description: University botanical garden founded in the 1500s. Quiet green corners right in the city.

Nature & Relaxation.name: Parco della Chiusa (Talon)
Nature & Relaxation.description: Riverside trails and forested paths just outside Bologna‚Äîeasy nature escape with hill views.

Nature & Relaxation.name: Colle della Guardia (San Luca Hill)
Nature & Relaxation.description: Shady walks under the porticoes up to the sanctuary; rewarding panoramas and a relaxed hilltop vibe.

cities.local_food_tip: Try tagliatelle al rag√π (the real ‚ÄòBolognese‚Äô), tortellini in brodo, and a mortadella panino. For dessert, grab pistachio or crema gelato‚ÄîBologna‚Äôs gelato game is strong!

full_day.morning: Start at Piazza Maggiore ‚õ≤, step into Archiginnasio üéì and its Anatomical Theatre, then coffee by the porticoes ‚òï.
full_day.afternoon: Wander the Quadrilatero üßÄü•ñ for lunch, peek through the Finestrella üì∏, and explore MAMbo or the Pinacoteca üñºÔ∏è.
full_day.evening: Golden hour by the Two Towers üåá, then aperitivo along Via del Pratello ü•§ and a pasta dinner (tagliatelle al rag√π!) üçù.
full_day.night: If it‚Äôs warm, catch open-air cinema at Piazza Maggiore üé¨; otherwise, evening stroll under the porticoes üåô and gelato nightcap üç®.

spring.highlight: Portico walks burst into life‚Äîfresh green parks and mild temps make San Luca hikes extra pleasant.

ideas.name: Giardini Margherita Picnics
ideas.description: Blossoms, ducks, and lawn time‚Äîgrab focaccia from Quadrilatero and make it a chill picnic.

ideas.name: Santo Stefano Courtyards
ideas.description: Soft spring light + medieval brick = gorgeous photos and a calm vibe.

summer.highlight: Long evenings, gelato runs, and film nights in the main square; museums offer cool air and cool art.

ideas.name: Open-Air Cinema (Piazza Maggiore)
ideas.description: Classic films on a giant screen under the stars‚Äîbring water, it can be toasty.

ideas.name: San Luca Sunset
ideas.description: Walk or bus + short hike; sunsets over terracotta rooftops are unreal.

autumn.highlight: Food season! Markets overflow with mushrooms, truffles (nearby), and hearty pasta; student life buzzes.

ideas.name: Pinacoteca & Coffee Crawl
ideas.description: Art indoors then cozy caf√©s‚Äîperfect for breezy days.

ideas.name: Hills & Vineyards (nearby)
ideas.description: Short trips into the Colli Bolognesi for leaf colors and grape harvest scenes.

winter.highlight: Festive lights, Christmas markets under porticoes, and steaming bowls of tortellini in brodo.

ideas.name: Fiera di Santa Lucia (Market)
ideas.description: Traditional stalls under the Portico dei Servi‚Äîcandies, nativity scenes, gifts.

ideas.name: Museum Day
ideas.description: Stay warm and explore multiple museums back-to-back with caf√© breaks.

public_transport_tips.tip: City buses are run by TPER; buy tickets at newsstands, machines, or via their app before boarding where required.
From the airport to Bologna Centrale, use the Marconi Express monorail (fast and frequent).
Regional trains connect Bologna with Emilia-Romagna cities (Ferrara, Modena, Parma, Rimini).
Check municipal mobility info for ZTL (limited-traffic zones) and bike routes if you‚Äôre cycling.

city_events.description: Arte Fiera Bologna‚Äîmajor contemporary art fair with galleries, talks, and citywide exhibitions.
Il Cinema Ritrovato & Sotto le Stelle del Cinema‚Äîrestored classics and outdoor screenings in the main square.
Fiera di Santa Lucia‚Äîhistoric Christmas market with a cozy, old-world feel.
BilBOlbul‚Äîinternational comics festival with exhibitions, signings, and workshops across town.

places.name: Piazza Maggiore
places.description: Central square framed by medieval palaces and the mighty Basilica‚Äîepic backdrop for any Bologna intro.

places.name: Basilica di San Petronio
places.description: Half-finished marble facade, giant interior, and a solar meridian line used to track the sun.

places.name: Le Due Torri
places.description: Asinelli & Garisenda‚Äîthe city‚Äôs leaning mascots and navigation beacons.

places.name: Archiginnasio & Anatomical Theatre
places.description: Carved wooden lecture hall, anatomical statues, and walls covered in student coats of arms.

places.name: Quadrilatero
places.description: Lively food quarter with delis, pasta shops, and tiny eateries‚ÄîBologna‚Äôs taste lab.

places.name: Santo Stefano (Seven Churches)
places.description: A maze of courtyards and chapels that tell Bologna‚Äôs early medieval story.

places.name: MAMbo
places.description: Modern and contemporary art hub with rotating exhibitions.

places.name: Giardini Margherita
places.description: Green lungs of the city‚Äîperfect for a breather between museums and meals.

places.name: Sanctuary of Madonna di San Luca
places.description: Hilltop sanctuary reached by the world-famous portico. Views for days.

hidden_gems.name: Museo della Specola (Astronomy Tower)
hidden_gems.description: 18th-century observatory with instruments and a tower climb‚Äîscience + skyline.

hidden_gems.name: Biblioteca Salaborsa (Glass Floor Ruins)
hidden_gems.description: Public library where you can see Roman remains through the glass floor. Free and fascinating.

hidden_gems.name: Casa Isolani Portico
hidden_gems.description: Medieval wooden beams soaring over Strada Maggiore‚Äîblink and you‚Äôll miss this time portal.

hidden_gems.name: Certosa di Bologna (Monumental Cemetery)
hidden_gems.description: Open-air museum of sculpture and architecture; peaceful, reflective, and visually striking.

hidden_gems.name: Eremo di Ronzano (Viewpoint)
hidden_gems.description: Short hike to a quiet hermitage with panoramic views over Bologna‚Äôs red roofs.

cities.name: Florence, Italy

Art & Culture.name: Uffizi Gallery
Art & Culture.description: One of the world‚Äôs greatest art museums with masterpieces by Botticelli, Leonardo da Vinci, and Michelangelo. Book ahead‚Äîlines can be long!

Art & Culture.name: Galleria dell'Accademia
Art & Culture.description: Home to Michelangelo‚Äôs ‚ÄòDavid‚Äô and other Renaissance sculptures. A must-see for art fans.

Art & Culture.name: Duomo di Firenze & Brunelleschi‚Äôs Dome
Art & Culture.description: The symbol of Florence. Climb the dome for 360¬∞ views and marvel at the frescoes inside.

Art & Culture.name: Palazzo Vecchio
Art & Culture.description: City hall turned museum with secret rooms, frescoes, and tower climbs for great photos.

Art & Culture.name: Basilica di Santa Croce
Art & Culture.description: Gothic church filled with tombs of Italian legends like Michelangelo and Galileo.

Photo Spots.name: Piazzale Michelangelo
Photo Spots.description: Epic panoramic view of Florence, especially at sunset. Bring a gelato and a camera!

Photo Spots.name: Ponte Vecchio
Photo Spots.description: Famous medieval bridge lined with goldsmith shops. Great reflections at twilight.

Photo Spots.name: Boboli Gardens
Photo Spots.description: Renaissance garden behind Palazzo Pitti with sculptures, fountains, and skyline views.

Photo Spots.name: Arno River Banks
Photo Spots.description: Walk or cycle along the river for peaceful vibes and pastel reflections of the city.

Food & Nightlife.name: Mercato Centrale
Food & Nightlife.description: Bustling indoor market with fresh pasta, pizza, and Tuscan street food. Upstairs has trendy eateries.

Food & Nightlife.name: Trattoria Mario
Food & Nightlife.description: A local favorite for authentic Florentine steak and homemade pasta. No frills, all flavor.

Food & Nightlife.name: Gelateria dei Neri
Food & Nightlife.description: Top-tier gelato near Santa Croce‚Äîtry pistachio or dark chocolate üç¶.

Food & Nightlife.name: Piazza Santo Spirito
Food & Nightlife.description: Lively nightlife spot filled with caf√©s, bars, and student energy.

Food & Nightlife.name: All‚ÄôAntico Vinaio
Food & Nightlife.description: Huge sandwiches stuffed with local meats and cheeses‚ÄîFlorentine street food perfection.

Nature & Relaxation.name: Giardino Bardini
Nature & Relaxation.description: Terraced garden with flowers, fountains, and one of the best skyline views of Florence.

Nature & Relaxation.name: Cascine Park
Nature & Relaxation.description: Florence‚Äôs largest park‚Äîperfect for picnics, cycling, or weekend markets.

Nature & Relaxation.name: Rose Garden (Giardino delle Rose)
Nature & Relaxation.description: Lovely garden below Piazzale Michelangelo with sculptures and city views.

Nature & Relaxation.name: Boboli Gardens
Nature & Relaxation.description: Expansive gardens perfect for a slow afternoon walk through Renaissance history.

cities.local_food_tip: Order a bistecca alla fiorentina (Florentine steak), ribollita soup, and cantucci with vin santo for dessert. Florence‚Äôs food is rustic, hearty, and unforgettable!

full_day.morning: Start at the Duomo ‚õ™‚Äîclimb the dome early, then visit Uffizi Gallery üé® for masterpieces.
full_day.afternoon: Grab lunch at Mercato Centrale üçù, stroll Ponte Vecchio üåâ, and relax in Boboli Gardens üå≥.
full_day.evening: Head to Piazzale Michelangelo üåá for sunset views, then dinner at a trattoria near Piazza Santo Spirito üç∑.
full_day.night: Enjoy a walk by the Arno River üåô and treat yourself to gelato üç® before bed.

spring.highlight: The city blooms with flowers; gardens and terraces open up‚Äîideal weather for walking tours.

ideas.name: Giardino Bardini Wisteria Bloom
ideas.description: A sea of purple wisteria frames Florence‚Äôs skyline‚ÄîInstagram dream spot.

ideas.name: Easter Procession
ideas.description: Historic ‚ÄòScoppio del Carro‚Äô fireworks celebration in front of the Duomo.

summer.highlight: Warm nights, open-air concerts, and golden sunsets over the Arno River.

ideas.name: Firenze Rocks Festival
ideas.description: Big-name music festival at the city park with rock, pop, and summer vibes.

ideas.name: Evening Walks by the Arno
ideas.description: Cool breeze, street musicians, and glowing bridges‚Äîit‚Äôs Florence magic.

autumn.highlight: Fewer crowds, soft light, and harvest season for Tuscan food and wine lovers.

ideas.name: Wine Tasting in Chianti (nearby)
ideas.description: Short trip south of Florence to taste local wines among rolling hills.

ideas.name: Museo dell‚ÄôOpera del Duomo
ideas.description: Perfect for cooler days; discover sculptures and the original Baptistery doors.

winter.highlight: Holiday lights, cozy caf√©s, and festive markets around the piazzas.

ideas.name: Christmas Market at Piazza Santa Croce
ideas.description: Traditional wooden stalls, gifts, and sweet scents of cinnamon and vin brul√©.

ideas.name: Museums & Hot Chocolate Day
ideas.description: Stay warm inside art museums, then grab a rich hot chocolate at Rivoire Caf√©.

public_transport_tips.tip: ATAF manages Florence‚Äôs buses and trams‚Äîbuy tickets via app, vending machines, or tobacco shops.
Florence‚Äôs tram lines (T1‚ÄìT3) connect the airport, station, and major spots‚Äîfast and budget-friendly.
The main station, Firenze Santa Maria Novella, is the hub for regional and national trains.
Historic center is best explored on foot‚Äîcheck local bike-share and pedestrian zones for easy access.

city_events.description: Scoppio del Carro‚Äîspectacular fireworks from an antique cart in front of the Duomo.
Calcio Storico‚Äîhistoric costumed football match that‚Äôs pure Florentine tradition.
Florence Biennale‚Äîinternational contemporary art fair with global artists.
German-style Christmas Market filling the square with festive food and crafts.

places.name: Cathedral of Santa Maria del Fiore (Duomo)
places.description: Florence‚Äôs stunning cathedral with Brunelleschi‚Äôs dome and marble fa√ßade.

places.name: Uffizi Gallery
places.description: Iconic art museum with Renaissance masterpieces by Italy‚Äôs greatest artists.

places.name: Ponte Vecchio
places.description: The city‚Äôs most famous bridge, packed with gold shops and views of the Arno.

places.name: Palazzo Vecchio
places.description: Historic palace on Piazza della Signoria, full of secret passageways and art.

places.name: Boboli Gardens
places.description: Expansive garden filled with statues, fountains, and shady lanes.

places.name: Piazzale Michelangelo

cities.local_food_tip: Try risotto alla milanese (saffron risotto), cotoletta, and panettone if you‚Äôre visiting around winter. Don‚Äôt miss aperitivo hour‚ÄîMilan invented it!

full_day.morning: Start at the Duomo üïç‚Äîclimb the rooftop, then explore the Galleria üõçÔ∏è for breakfast pastries.

full_day.night: Enjoy city lights along Corso Como üåÉ or a chill dessert stop for gelato üç®.

spring.highlight: Perfect weather for open-air caf√©s, fashion walks, and blooming parks.

public_transport_tips.tip: ATM operates Milan‚Äôs metro, trams, and buses‚Äîuse the app or ticket machines at stations.

full_day.morning: ‚òÄÔ∏è Begin your exploration at Arena di Verona, then wander through the lively stalls of Piazza delle Erbe. Check out the historic frescoed fa√ßades and grab a coffee at a caf√© overlooking the square.
full_day.afternoon: üçù Head to Juliet‚Äôs Balcony for photos of Verona‚Äôs most romantic legend, then stroll across the river to Ponte Pietra and enjoy lunch near the water.
full_day.evening: üç∑ Explore Veronese wines with cicchetti at Antica Bottega del Vino and other local bars, then relax as the lights come up in Piazza delle Erbe caf√©s.
full_day.night: üåÉ Cap off your night with a stroll along the Adige Riverside, enjoying the peaceful glimmer of lights on the water before heading to a trattoria for a late-night Veronese dinner.
